etymology.description: 菠(bō, with grass radical) + 萝(luó, with grass radical) ≈ bōluó = pineapple.
etymology.interpretation: Transliterated plant name: characters were chosen mainly for sound, with the grass radical signaling a botanical term. In many regions (esp. Taiwan), 凤梨 is the more common synonym.
etymology.simplification: 蘿 was simplified to 萝 by adopting 罗 for 羅 and using the simplified grass radical; 菠 is unchanged.

examples.chinese: 我最爱菠萝(我最愛菠蘿)。
超市有新鲜的菠萝(超市有新鮮的菠蘿)。
在台湾，人们常说凤梨而不是菠萝(在臺灣，人們常說鳳梨而不是菠蘿)。
examples.pinyin: Zài Táiwān, rénmen cháng shuō fènglí ér bù shì bōluó.
examples.english: In Taiwan, people usually say fènglí instead of bōluó.
